dialogues.text: (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever watched a man die?  If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping.  And if you're very quick, you can catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... Butterfield... I wasn't there.  Ask Pimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared.  They knew the Puritan was coming home.  As this exchange goes on, Miller pulls the lock out of th door and starts to THROW HIMSELF against it from the othe side.  It's all Harry can do to keep himself from being pitched across the room.  He looks around for some means defense.  There's a crack in the drapes to the left of th table.  Behind it a WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you.  You've seen the future.  Haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Suddenly, Harry steps aside.  The door's flung open. Mill CHARGES in.  Harry catches hold of his arm, and THROWS hi against the drape.  The window CRACKS; the drape comes do around Miller.  Amber STREETLIGHT floods in.  Butterfield is momentarily distracted.  Harry STRIKES the scalpel from his hands.  Miller, meanwhile, is struggling to free himself from the folds of the drapes.  Harry lands a solid KICK to the man belly.  Miller is THROWN back against the cracked window, which SHATTERS.  Still wrapped in the drape, he FALLS OUT Harry turns back to arrest Butterfield, but he's already making his escape.  Harry starts after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me. He turns back.  TEARS are pouring down the man's face. Ha goes back to comfort Quaid, as Butterfield escapes down t stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  Why are you here? Did you cone... up here for a reading?  Quaid takes hold of Harry's hand.

dialogues.speaker: NO ... I...
dialogues.text: Quaid stares at Harry's HAND.  Fascinated, he momentarily forgets his pain.  He traces the lines with bloody finger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've taken some strange journeys in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  You could say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drawn to the dark side, over and over.  And it's drawn to you. (looks at Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't change it.  You have to walk... (coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...walk the line between Heaven and Hell.  It's your destiny.  Accept it. Harry takes his hand from Quaid's grip.  Quaid winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Puritan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?  Quaid shudders, and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly; sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He looks away, down at the CARDS.  All have been turned o but ONE.  He turns it.  The card is the Ten of Swords whi pictures a prostrate man against a thunderous sky, pierce all ten swords.  An image of death and desolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashing LIGHTS of two patrol cars illuminate the sce DETECTIVE EDDISON, a surfer-turned-policeman with buzz-cu blond hair, heads along the alley with Harry.  He's midwa through taking Harry's statement. There are already two OFFICERS examining the drapes.  We can't yet see the body

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a private detective.  I was hired to follow somebody for a few days.  A guy called Tapert. Insurance fraud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tapert.  So, now I've got Tapert, Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tapert's got nothing to do with this.  He came here to get his palm read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a file on him two inches thick.  He's a petty fraudster. This is something else.  Ever heard of someone called the Puritan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New one on me. (to Officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let's see him. OFFICER #l shakes his head, and opens up the drape. Broke GLASS drops from the folds, but that's all. Miller has go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got up and walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that fall?. He must have broken half his bones. WE MOVE IN ON HARRY, as he stares down at the drape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he'd have given a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rooms are spartan.  Nothing on the walls.  Nothing on floors.  Very little furniture.  Butterfield sits beside the window, obsessively combing h long hair.  There is something feminine about him now:  h voice a whisper, his stare distracted.  If we didn't gues already, we're in the presence of a madman.  Miller is squatting against the wall, picking shards of G out of his torso.  It hurts, but he's enjoying himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Amour... D'Amour... Why do I know that name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him.  I saw him. He stops to pull out a particularly large piece of glass, sighing with pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him on T.V.  Some kid got possessed and he saved the little bastard's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a priest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He's just a guy who's got a nose for this shit. (a beat.  A smirk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you. A long beat of silence.  Butterfield combs.  Miller digs glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him getting in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't.  Another silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all of us waited too long to have the homecoming spoiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "all of us?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think it was just going to be you and me?  A lot of people believed in Nix. They haven't forgotten his promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an illusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen:  Philadelphia  A suburban street.  Early morning light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP of a PHOTOGRAPH of the Cultist with the Painted Face, from the opening scene, standing outside Nix's hous Nevada.  His name is Norman Sanders.  ON NORMAN, thirteen years older, looking down at the photograph.  He lays it down, beside a letter, on which t words are written: "Homecoming Time." Norman smiles to himself.  Goes to the wardrobe.  Gets ou small suitcase.  His WIFE'S BODY is slumped in the wardro glassy-eyed.  CLOSE UP of letter -В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—- and DRAW OUT from the letter to a different interior, different domestic circumstance.  On the screen:  Miami.  BARBARA - the blonde girl who carved the cult's sigil int her chest - is washing her hands.  She casually dries the and picks up the letter, walking past her HUSBAND and SON both DEAD at the breakfast table, BLOOD spreading around their heads.  When she gets to the door she steps over th body of her DAUGHTER, who has also been shot trying to es her mother's murder spree.  ON THE RADIO, George Harrison sings "My Sweet Lord."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I really want to see you, Lord, And it won't take long, my Lord, My sweet Lord..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen:  San Antonio.  A ZOO-KEEPER wanders into the darkened interior of the Reptile House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zoo-keeper's benign expression changes at the sight o the chaos inside.  The glass cases have been SMASHED. Ano KEEPER lies on the ground, his face pulped.  A few SNAKES slither around his body, but most of them have gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Snake-Handler Cultist drives at speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP from another letter'- with the same message - on t dashboard, to the crazed face of the Snake-Handler. PAN T the back of the car.  IT SEETHES WITH HUNDREDS OF SNAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's early morning in Bel-Air.  The sun shines down on a millionaire's paradise:  a huge house surrounded by a jun of trees and blossoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue water glitters in the noon-day sun.  And a WOMAN her body perfectly proportioned -- glides under the surfa emerging at the shallow end, where the housekeeper CLEMEN is setting a tray on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee, Mrs. Swann? Mrs. Swann's name is DOROTHEA.  She is a beautiful and sensual woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  She dries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mr. Swann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his study. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got something on his mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad mood today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venetian blinds shut out most of the sunlight, but a lamp burns on the desk (huge), showing us the furniture (leath the books (innumerable), and the figure of SWANN, sitting behind the desk smoking a CIGAR.  He's lost some hair and some colour over the years, but he still has the same hypnotic eyes. He studies the L.A. TIMES in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OPEN PAGE
dialogues.text: "Fortune Teller Brutally Murdered," the headline announce Underneath, a PHOTOGRAPH of Quaid's wrecked room.  WE CLO IN on the photograph, and catch a glimpse of Harry, stand looking at the chaos.  CAMERA. MOVES DOWN to the text beneath, and on to the name "Harry D'Amour."  ON SWANN, pensive as he studies the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...  He looks up, startled. DOROTHEA The sun's shining out there. Dorothea is dressed a white robe now.  She literally brings light into this gloomy room.  On the shelves behind Swann are a number of brut figurines, vaguely recalling the idols outside Nix's "temple."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad show last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual.  Full house. Standing ovation.  I tell them it's magic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distastefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... they believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Quaid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw him. A difficult silence.  Then Swann crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting in a new illusion tonight.  Will you be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  You want me to find out about Quaid?  I mean, the funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (superstitiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going near him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTIN is overseeing the hanging of a new piece in Swan collection:  a huge, framed POSTER from a late nineteenth century magic spectacular.  Valentin is fifty or so, his hair combed back close to his scalp. Immaculately dressed a distinctively European fashion.  Precise.  Cautious.  Elegant.  He orders the TWO PICTURE-HANGERS in a clipped fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Higher.  Another inch.  The left hand side's too low. Dorothea descends the stairs, dressed for the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hangers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  There. (to Dorothea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives him the newspaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw this? Valentin nods.  They walk back through the house together while the picture-hanging goes on behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to find this man D'Amour for me. She passes the newspaper to Valentin.  He looks down at i

dialogues.speaker: ON NEWSPAPER.
dialogues.text: C.U. of Harry's blurred PICTURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is sprawled on the bed, in his under shorts.  A sha sun darts between the drapes, missing his face by inches. Somebody is knocking on the door, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...? He rolls over.  The sun strikes his eyes.  He winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. D'Amour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak to you, Mr. D'Amour.  About last night. Harry gets up and stumbles to the door.  He opens it a little.  The face of VALENTIN is visible through the crac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever I said, I didn't mean it, okay?  I get a few drinks inside me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've never met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to offer you a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to New York in-- (consults his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got a job that'll pay you five thousand a day? A beat.  Then Harry takes the chain off the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white SEDAN glides along the boulevard.  At the wheel, Valentin.  Beside him, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is eating a burrito and sipping coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose is the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  You're driving it too carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sparring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I just bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's been smoking in here for months. He pulls open the ashtray. Pulls out a cigar-butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havanas.  You're not the smoker.  So who is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could almost pass for a detective, D'Amour. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for the best illusionist in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip Swann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him in Vegas once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a gambling man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I can afford to lose. Swann's quite a magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never call him that.  He's strictly an illusionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illusions are trickery. Magicians do it for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan turns into a driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun beats down on a pristine panorama of palms and wh marble tombs.  Harry and Valentin walk towards a large mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any movie stars buried here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a bad place.  Warm. Great view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think the dead much care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a believer, then? Valentin gives him an inquisitive look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've signed on for them all in my time.  Hindu.  Catholic. You can't have too many saviours. Harry's gaze is on the mausoleum now; or rather on the wo in white standing in its cool shadows:  Dorothea Swann. wears a wide-brimmed hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swann's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALENTIN sitting on the mausoleum steps reading a book. glances up.  Harry and Dorothea are wandering between the graves, deep conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to help me help my husband.  I know he's in some kind of trouble.  And it's something to do with the man you saw murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your husband know Quaid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  They weren't close, but they saw each other once in a while.  I think Philip believes all that stuff with the tarot cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we make our own futures. Harry makes an approving MURMUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the connection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering now, but well)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't exactly know.  Philip doesn't like to talk about the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Dorothea stops talking.  Takes off her sunglasses.  Her g is troubled, but direct.  There is an attraction between two of them that simmers beneath the dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a secretive man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't ask questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't share our lives the way a lot of people do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't slept in the same bed for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But obviously you still care what happens to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't be having this conversation if I didn't. Swann's one of the most remarkable men alive. Harry, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an illusionist.  It's not exactly brain surgery.  Dorothea stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  You asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You're right.  He could have been something more. Maybe a lot more.  But people get lost.  Even good people. Too much fame.  Too much money,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I sign?  Dorothea LAUGHS lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take the job, Mr. D'Amour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I'm asking for. I want somebody who can find out what Philip saw in those damn cards.  And stop it from happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you want me to start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to the show with me. Tonight I want you to see him with an audience.  They love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? The question catches Dorothea off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't marry him for love, Mr. D'Amour.  Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Dorothea makes a little smile, and walks away.  Harry wat her go, exhaling an appreciative breath at the sight of h departing figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's talking on the phone while he dresses for the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me, Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOMIS, a slob of a man, is in his office, eating pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The case is closed. Harry. Tapert's given us a full confession.  Get your ass back to Mew York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm taking a couple of weeks' vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never took a fucking vacation in your life, Harry. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to go.  I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's other guys as good as me, Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  But not as cheap.  Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she? Harry can't help but smile to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so.  'Night, Harry. Click.  Harry puts down the phone.  Glances at himself in mirror.  Raises a rueful eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN from a looming STANDEE of Swann, perched above theatre marquee.  SPOTLIGHTS rake the skies. The sidewalk below is jammed with AUDIENCE MEMBERS, STAR-SPOTTERS and PHOTOGRAPHERS.  This is a flashy, prestigious event.  LIM are disgorging scantily- dressed STARLETS and smiling MON MEN; a NEWS TEAM is interviewing audience members as they file in.  The atmosphere is noisy and excited.  Amid the throng, Ha He makes his way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atmosphere, is closer to a rock concert than a conventional stage show.  Security people with walkie- talkies roam the aisles; the audience buzzes with barely controlled hysteria.  Harry heads down the aisle, eyes on the stage.  A star-li CURTAIN covers it.  Six rows from the stage is Dorothea, already in her seat.  She smiles lavishly, happy to see h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you could make it.  Harry takes a seat beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is a big deal for me. You know what seats like this cost in New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center-stage, behind the closed curtains, Swann is ready the opening of the show.  TECHNICIANS buzz around him lik flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin! Valentin emerges from the wings, patting the PANTHER that waiting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy with Dorothea.  Is that who I think it is?  Valentin nods. ON SWANN, his expression unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's young. MUSIC strikes up.  A dramatic, Wagnerian chord. Valentin hurries away.  Swann's expression becomes very focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Swann)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. Swann rises up into the flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck does he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wires, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never seen no wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is it?  Magic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHTS are DIMMING.  Harry glances across at Dorothea whose gaze is intent.  The LIGHTS go OUT.  The MUSIC SWELLS, and the CURTAINS fl apart.  A spectacle worthy of Seigfried and Roy is about blast our senses!  Magic for the 90's:  a wild, erotic ri into mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen.  You are standing on the threshold of a miracle... A vortex of SMOKE and LIGHT swirls in the middle of the stage.  The vortex BLAZES --  And suddenly Swann SWEEPS DOWN out of the flies, as the f of the stage opens and the head of a glittering, razor toothed DRAGON emerges in a cloud of CRIMSON SMOKE.  Swann raises his hands above his head and a SPEAR miraculously appears in his grasp.  He descends on the dragon.  It's a classic image:  St. Michael smiting the Devil.  Swann drives the spear down the throat of the dra The theatre SHAKES at its dying ROARS.  Then the head cra open, and out of the dragon's mouth emerge a dozen scanti dressed DANCERS, male and female.  Swann throws down the spear, and where it strikes the stage his PANTHER appears A ROAR of APPLAUSE from the audience.  Swann's plain whit tunic falls away from him as he descends.  By the time hi feet touch the stage he is dressed in a star- shot TUXEDO The PANTHER licks his hand in welcome. The MUSIC comes to crescendo.  The DANCERS freeze in their erotic dance.  In sudden hush, Swann speaks in a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends ... come with me...into the Great Beyond. A barrage of LIGHTS and MUSIC erupt.  The AUDIENCE APPLAUDS wildly.  ON HARRY and Dorothea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't seen anything yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors SQUEAK as a gust of WIND blows through them.  Butterfield stands in the lobby, listening to the muted SOUNDS of MUSIC and APPLAUSE.  Then he offers his ticket the TICKET-COLLECTOR and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new musical motif hangs in the air:  MUSIC announcing danger.  The AUDIENCE watches intently, nervously.  ON HARRY and DOROTHEA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the new illusion. ON STAGE, Swann is bound to a spinning WHEEL, while the DANCERS, dressed like Boschian DEMONS, cavort around him, somersaulting and leaping over eruptions of yellow FLAME. It's a scene from Daniels Inferno.  Above him. a dozen glittering SWORDS - six feet long - are descending.  He struggles to free himself.  The MUSIC gets more exciting the wheel spins faster and faster.  Suddenly, a sword DROPS.  It falls between Swann's outstretched legs, skewering the wheel.  Then ANOTHER, cl to his head.  ON HARRY.  He's tense.  Excited.  BACK TO STAGE.  Swann is free I  He throws off the last shackle and uses it to thrust into the mechanism of the wheel.  There's a theatrical BLAZE of white-hot SPARKS. The wheel slows.  He starts to step off it, as another of the swords DROPS.  The AUDIENCE GASPS.  Swann smiles, and TRIPS.  As he FALLS, the sword runs through the middle of his bac carrying him down to the still-spinning wheel, and pinnin him there.  Some of the DANCERS continue to cavort.  Some stop.  More GASPS from the audience.  ON HARRY, having a --  FLASHBACK:  Harry's hand turns over the final tar of card The scene on the stage is that image coming to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something wrong...  ON Swann, as a second sword FALLS, skewering his thigh, a third, running through his buttock, and a fourth and fift until TEN SWORDS have entered his body.  ON THE AUDIENCE, not certain whether this is a trick or n The MUSIC has stopped.  In the silence, somebody GIGGLES nervously.  A couple of PEOPLE break into APPLAUSE, but i dies away in a matter of moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. . . ON THE STAGE, Swann raises his head and looks out at his wife, his eyes already glassy with imminent death.  He reaches out towards her, and then sags on the wheel, dead There are GASPS now from the audience.  Murmurs of disgus sobs of horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody help him. The curtains start to close. ON Dorothea, tears of shock filling her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get to him! The AUDIENCE is rising now, as the horror of what they've seen sinks in.  There is panic.  A few people have fainte One or two are even praying.  Harry carves out a path down to the stage for Dorothea against the flood of the exiting crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the way!  Out of the way! He helps Dorothea onto the stage, and lifts the curtain s she can duck beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos.  PEOPLE running, sobbing, puking; some simply stan watching.  Valentin is already at the body, with the STAG MANAGER at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stage Manager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get then out of here, for God's sake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard him!  It's not a fucking show! He starts to physically push the crowd back.  Harry grabs arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Harry uses his grip to gently but efficiently move the ST MANAGER out of Dorothea's way.  She goes to Swann's body, which has been removed from the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is clearing now.  But Butterfield is coming towards the stage, with an ambiguous look on his face. Is enraged?  Or puzzled?  Or both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst! Miller stands at an open door, leading below the stage. Butterfield enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothea kneels at Swann's side.  A few yards from her, H examines the mechanism of the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swann...  A DOCTOR appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor.  Let me through.  The Doctor checks Swann's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dorothea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Harry has discovered a CABLE snaking down beside the devi He's suspicious.  He slips round to the back of the mechanism, and climbs down beneath the stage, tracing the cable as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: WILTERN THEATRE
dialogues.text: It's an eerie, shadowy space, filled with the PROPS that used in the show, including the DRAGON we saw at the beginning.  From above we hear FOOTSTEPS and VOICES, mute and echoing.  The cable ends in bare wires.  Whatever was here has been taken.  A NOISE, behind Harry.  He swings round.  Sees a shadowy FIGURE ducking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He gives chase.  Loses the man in the shadows.  Stops and listens for movement.  Suddenly, Miller steps out of the shadows with a plank of wood and smashes it into Harry's face! Harry reels back.  Falls to his knees, BLOOD running from nose.  Miller pulls Harry's GUN out of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you, fucker! Harry is facing the dragon's head, dazed.  And now, out o the dragon's mouth, comes Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this, D'Amour?  Who killed Swann?  Harry is barely holding on to consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me. Butterfield is a foot from Harry now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a clue what you're into, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep shit?  Butterfield hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- Butterfield hits him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  It was... Butterfield comes a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning a near collapse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it was... Butterfield leans in.  And Harry grabs him by the balls - literally -- rising as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah! Harry THROWS Butterfield aside. Butterfield hits the grou in agony, and Harry swings round to protect himself from Miller, who's leveling Harry's gun.  He FIRES once, missing Harry by inches.  Harry catches ho of a ROPE underfoot and pulls it, tripping Miller, who TOPPLES backwards into the mouth of the dragon.  The GUN OFF again, the bullet BLOWING APART the dragon's JAW

dialogues.speaker: MECHANISM.
dialogues.text: Miller starts to sit up, his body splayed between the dragon's steel teeth.  He has Harry in his sights.  -- something CREAKS.  He looks up.  The dragon's jaw is closing, FAST.  He starts to scramble to his feet.  Too l The teeth SLAM CLOSED on his body.  Sudden death.  Harry looks round to see Butterfield retreating into the shadows.  Then he's gone.  Harry looks down at Miller's BLOOD, which is pooling around his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits at Eddison's desk, looking exhausted and bruis Eddison has just finished taking his statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this Butterfield guy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another fucking magician. Jesus. Harry looks past Eddison and sees an ashen, tearful Dorot being taken into another office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you finished with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.  Are you planning to go back to New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Dorothea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothea sits alone, staring at the wall.  Harry enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they treating you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard what happened.  It looks like somebody murdered him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I got into this too late.  But if you want me to stick around, maybe dig where the cops don't look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you'd start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... how about some of the other illusionists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't tell you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be very persuasive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I think you probably can. (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd need to talk about your fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the fee.  If I find Butterfield, maybe we'll talk about money.  If I don't... (he shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my gamble.  Either way... I get to spend some time... here. The way he says this, it's plain "here" doesn't mean L.A. means near -Dorothea.  And by the tiny smile on her face, it's also plain she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noon.  Bright sun.  Busy street.  Harry, now wearing a bandage on his cut face, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wonderland for illusionists.  Books, props, masks, tric etc.  Two or three CUSTOMERS browse.  Harry glances at th all, then targets a MAN in late middle age, who is browsi through books, one-handed.  His other hand constantly manipulates a card, concealing and revealing it in a doze ways.  He doesn't even look at his hand.  His name is WAL

dialogues.speaker: WILDER.
dialogues.text: Harry stands beside him.  Scans the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At birth.  I don't know you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry D'Amour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all the kids coming up. Got to stay ahead of the game. But I don't know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in from New York.  I came to see Swann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a tragedy.  It was just a matter of time, of course, but it's not good for the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he taking a lot of risks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know the half of it. I'm Walter Wilder, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the Walter Wilder?  Walter beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one and only.  He hands Harry a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to try? Harry tries to emulate Wilder's card manipulation through rest of this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Vinovich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not a clue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Vivovich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew Swann way back.  He says there were a lot of drugs, a lot of crazy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to... you know... hang with some of you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are pretty cagey.  Who do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an introduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... nobody. Wilder takes a moment to assess Harry, who is attempting manipulate the card he's been given with charming ineptit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (magnanimously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle is faux, of course, but it has a Gothic charm. Harry and Walter wander towards the front door.  Harry is knotting a newly-bought tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only wear ties for funerals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get in without one. It's like a gentlemen's club for illusionists.  Except most of us aren't gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior is murky and atmospheric, the walls covered illusionists' posters.  Walter leads the way through the long corridors, past roo where illusionists are performing close-up magic for audiences of well-heeled patrons.  Walter nods and waves half a dozen people on their way through the house, up th stairs and towards the bar.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Are they all in the business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a business. Harry. It's a vocation.  Wilder points to a locked door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they call the Repository.  Every magic secret known to man's locked up in that room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  There's only three keys. Vinovich has got one, of course. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a little crazy, by the way.  And he's a mean drunk. Otherwise, he's a real charmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.  A drunken VINOVICH is holding court.  He's in his 40's:  a flamboyant and loquacious man with a heavy (and fake) middle-European accent.  At the table - besides Har and Walter - are:  Vinovich's starlet/nymphet girlfriend LAURA; an Asian-American illusionist called BILLY WHO; an two of Vinovich's adoring courtiers, an overblown, overdressed female illusionist - DEBRA DEVINE - and a thi waspish fellow in a spangly suit:  the AMAZING QUENTIN.  In the conversation that follows we go back to Harry repeatedly as he studies this extraordinary group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than entertainment. We're opening people's heads up.  Putting miracles back into their boring little lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're fake miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houdini believed he had spirit guides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we walk a narrow path, between... between...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven and Hell? Vinovich stares hard at Harry, trying to figure out wheth he's being sarcastic or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trickery and divinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying that sometimes the miracles are real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm saying they were always fake.  The saints, the messiahs, they were just illusionists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So could you walk on water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could reproduce any miracle that's ever been performed, with a little preparation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Swann's miracles? The smug smile on Vinovich's face dies.  Furtive glances exchanged around the table.  Only Billy Who makes a tiny smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't worth a damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he was the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he was so good why's he so dead? Vinovich begins to look suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.  No?  I thought you'd maybe have a theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I've got plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear them.  Vinovich rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying another word. (to Wilder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You damn fool.  He's a journalist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me about Swann.  Or are you too scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a freak.  Everything he did was tainted. Harry rises.  Looks straight at Vinovich, unintimidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil.  He was evil. (to Laura)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. She rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the rest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say nothing to this man if you wish to keep my company. He stalks away.  Harry calls after him, across a now- silenced bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great accent, by the way.  Is it Brooklyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pure Brooklyn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry heads to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry turns.  Billy approaches, glancing behind him to se that he's not being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta be careful.  If Vinovich sees me talking to you.  He's an asshole, but he's a powerful asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowered voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard a name.  Someone they talk about in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in nothing.  Nobody.  Nix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe he taught Swann. (hands Harry a card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me.  See ya around.  Billy hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lies on his bed, dozing.  The CAMERA CREEPS IN on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I want somebody who can find out what Philip saw in those damn cards...  Harry frowns in his semi-doze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever watched a man die? The image darkens, and fades up a beat later on Quaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I wasn't there... Ask Pimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is still asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home... A long silence.  SUDDENLY, a telephone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY sits up, shocked awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is D'Amour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up on her bed, dressed in a silk robe, and nothi else, drinking a SCOTCH, talking on the phone. The primar source of illumination is the massive T.V. set in the wal opposite the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry... I know it's late.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: There should be a subtle eroticism pervading this exchang Both of them on beds, in different bedrooms. Each aroused the other's voice, and frustrated not to be able to see a touch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. As he speaks, Harry scrawls Jennifer Desiderio on the tit page of the Gideon's Bible beside the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it go today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went up to the Magic Castle. You were right.  He didn't have a lot of fans up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin, on the kitchen PHONE, is listening in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were jealous of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Because he had you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... didn't have me..  I told you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't marry him for love.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHEA'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: She's a little uncomfortable now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did you marry him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my business. Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just curious. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to business.  Ever heard of a man called Nix? (silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I'm here.  And no.  I don't know the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Jennifer Desiderio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't ring a bell.  I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'll keep digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  You do that. She puts down the phone, and swallows a mouthful of scotc She's shaking.  She gets up.  Paces the room. Then she pi up the phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the pad beside the bed, Jennifer's name, surrounded by Harry's doodles.  The phone RINGS.  CUT WIDE:  The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tarot Card and Crystal Readings sign is dark now. Har heads up the stairs, past the PHOTOGRAPHS, to the door of Quaid's Waiting Room.  It has been locked and taped by the police.  Harry has co prepared.  He takes out a small crowbar and levers off th locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry enters, FLASHLIGHT on.  He crosses the Waiting Room enters the Fortune-Telling Room where Quaid died.  On the TRACK -- a remote, eerie presence -- we hear Quaid's SOBS Miller's SHOUTS, and, as Harry's flashlight illuminates t blood-spattered table:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping. Harry is spooked.  He starts to search the room, opening cabinets and drawers.  Quaid's hordes of mystical bric-a- are stashed everywhere.  Boxes of crystals, religious statues, elaborate cards, incense, etc. He pulls open a drawer, and notices that a rosary is wedg in a niche at the base of the drawer.  He pulls the drawe out, empties its contents on the table, and examines it.  Using the crowbar, he forces the drawer apart.  It has a false bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... In the secret compartment, some papers and an address boo He flicks to "D."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desiderio... There it is.  Jennifer Desiderio, and an address.  He poc the book.  Then, sensing a presence behind him, he pulls his gun and whirls around, his flashlight beam revealing -- Valentin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for you.  I tried the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a detective, with no clues.  Where else are you going to look?  I'm going to keep this brief. (he takes out an envelope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's thirty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ticket home,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hire me.  She did. If she wants me off the job, I want to hear it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to see you. She's had enough pain.  Enough churning over the past.  She wants it all left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left alone?  Somebody's been murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's regrettable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck regrettable!  I want to know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?  You need to stay busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a confession)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to know why things happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why people die? (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, D'Amour.  Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Harry crosses to the door, brushing past Valentin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try and see her, D'Amour. Just leave her alone.  Let her heal. He glances back at Valentin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock up, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE ADDRESS BOOK, in Harry's hands. Harry looks up - with some surprise - not at a house but building, the sign on which reads, "St. Luke's Sanitorium

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is bland and functional throughout, the walls decorated with sun-faded reproductions of great paintings Nothing disturbing.  Harry is talking to D.A. TOFFLER - black, fortyish, softly spoken - and a Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's only ever had one visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mister Quaid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  And he's dead, isn't he?  I saw it on the news. Jennifer doesn't know.  And frankly, this isn't the best tine for her to be told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toffler excorts Harry through -the place.  There are distressing scenes on every side.  Nothing melodramatic n screaming, no fits.  Just a subtle, pervasive air of desp Blank, empty FACES in blank, empty rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's been with us four years.  She was coming on nicely.  But just the last month or so, she's worse than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no real grip on reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a joke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.  We have to agree what's real and what's not. That's what holds us together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does Jennifer think's real? They've come to french windows, which are wide open. Sitt outside in the sun is Jennifer, with her back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer thinks the Devil's coming for her. (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer? Jennifer turns.  She looks terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Jennifer walk amongst the flower-beds, with the Nurse keeping a watch from a discreet distance. Throughou the scene we HEAR the SOUND of earth being dug, which steadily gets louder as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only I forget.  They give me pills, you know, to keep me... even... and... I forget things,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you didn't forget me.  I just came because I wanted to know if you knew a man called Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... I... don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Philip Swann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Swann. (sudden vehemence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fucking liar. A WORKMAN saunters past, carrying pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he knew how to protect us.  But he didn't know anything.  He made us think it was over and done with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears nearing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to think about it. If I think about it he'll hear me.  He'll find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swann? Ahead now, the site where the workmen are digging a hole, laying pipes.  The CAMERA doesn't focus on this action, b we're aware of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  I don't -- She stops.  Looks ahead of her.  Her face is suddenly ash and clammy.  Harry follows her gaze to:  The hole.  Somebody is in it, digging.  Earth emerges in shovelfuls, piling up beside the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no!  Oh God no! She backs away from the hole.  The Nurse grabs hold of he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down! She delivers the Nurse a backhand SWIPE.  The Nurse is fl back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to get me! She races down towards the street.  Harry goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not!  He's not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's not?  He catches up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nix! Nix!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he the Puritan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He's coming back.  He's digging his way out! The Nurse appears behind Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of her now. Jennifer struggles in Harry's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her, Mr. D'Amour! The Nurse breaks Harry's hold on Jennifer, who slips away instantly, racing towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer! She scrambles up over a wall, and flings herself from the top.  There's a SCREECH of brakes, then the smashing of metalwork and glass.  Harry gets to the wall before the Nurse.  Hoists himself up onto it.  Looks down.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Jennifer is dead in the middle of the street, beneath the wheels of a car.  The DRIVER is out, and yelling incoherently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He slips back down the wall, and leans against it. He looks towards the hole.  The Workman has stopped diggi His mud-encrusted hands emerge, and for a moment, before head appears, the image is eerily like somebody climbing a grave.  Harry closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is setting, the city giving way to night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Dorothea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid she's not in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will she be in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin on the phone in the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Valentin puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crank call.  I'll get the number changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No word from D'Amour?                             Valentin shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better he's gone.  He would have done more harm than good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harm to whom?  Me?  I don't think, so.  Try him again at the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left three messages already. Dorothea nods, plainly sad at Harry's desertion.  She tur and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BILLY WHO'S CARD, in Harry's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy?  It's Harry.  Suppose I wanted to get into the repository at the Magic Castle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had my moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's manipulating the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they'll have this place rigged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be something hokey.  CLICK! The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houdini'd been proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undusted shelves piled high with manuscripts, old books, posters in every direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... On the wall, plaster LIFE-MASKS.  In glass cases, the too of the great magicians:  KNIVES, KEYS, GUNS, WANDS, even IRON MAIDEN.  Billy is in awe.  He wanders around wide-ey while Harry scans the shelves. The dialogue runs as they investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear Mrs. Swann's quite a babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  She was killed in a car crash.  Her lawyer was driving. She was filing for divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life was too weird for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love weird. Harry has seen a small SIGIL carved onto one of the shelv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy?  This was on Miller's forehead.  Any idea what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Harry presses it.  The entire bookcase opens up, CREAKING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you?  So fucking hokey. Inside, there is a small shelf.  On it, FILES and PAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we got here? Ever-eager, Billy steps into the recess.  And --  two spiked, latticed gates close on his arm!  Harry grabs the gates before they snap closed, inches fro skewering Billy's flesh and bone!  He keeps them open, hi sinews straining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab the files! Billy reaches in and pulls out a handful of the files. As steps out of range. Harry lets go and the gates close wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! He slams the files down.  He's trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have lost my fucking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would have kept you out of the Magic Circle. (he studies the files)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which was presumably the idea. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are about Nix. Harry takes a sheaf of papers, and hands them to Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go through these.  Go on! Reluctantly, Billy does so.  Harry picks up a faded PHOTOGRAPH of the doorway to Nix's HOUSE (with the sigil painted on it) and BUTTERFIELD the child standing in the There are other CULTISTS standing around.  And in the DOO -- a barely visible figure (and all the more intimidating that) - is NIX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... He stares at the boy's face.  The eyes are clearly differ colours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Butterfield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to nan in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: doorway) And who's that? ON HARRY, staring at the ambiguous presence.  ON THE PHOTOGRAPH of the shadowy figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a guess?  The Puritan.  Nix. Billy picks up an ETCHING, water-stained and dirty.  It s a horror we recognize:  a man's HAND pressed into the FLE of another man's HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Nix specialty? Billy is getting subtly spooked now.  He puts the etching down and starts to go through others in the series.  We glimpse them as he does so.  In one, a MAN regurgitates a serpentine form made of FLAME.  In another, a MAN stares his own HAND which is STRIPPED OF FLESH.  There is no bon beneath.  Only a form of solid blackness.  In a third, we a HEAD with a slit in the middle of the brow, emanating DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any of these tricks... Harry studies the etchings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a slow burn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they're not tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mystified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, there's no instructions-- (realizes what Harry said)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, they're not tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Vinovich say? Something about walking a path between --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trickery and divinity.  Yeah, he says that all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because he knew.  He'd seen these files and knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knew what? Out of the corner of his eye. Harry sees a motion between book-stacks.  Billy frowns.  Harry puts his fingers to hi lips.  Gestures for Billy to take cover. Billy backs away Harry slowly turns in the direction of the motion.  Something eerily sepulchral is gliding between the stacks figure in a straight-jacket with his head bowed. Harry takes out his gun.  Billy disappears around the back of one of the stacks. Ha goes after the apparition.  The TRACK is completely silent.  Suddenly, the creature appears behind Billy!  It looks up its face that of a psychotic:  burning eyes, manic smile. It tears open its straight-jacket and reaches for Billy, backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry! Books tumble on top of Billy as he stumbles against the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you? Harry appears, and puts his gun to the PSYCHO'S head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Hold it right there. The gun goes through the Psycho's skull, as though it's m of smoke.  Harry waves his hands through it.  It's completely ethere But it's still terrorizing Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mortal terror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it off me! Harry glances around.  Sees a LIGHT flickering between so books.  FIRES at it.  The light goes out.  The "Psycho" vanishes.  Billy is left hyper-ventilating on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hokey enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of here, man!  Are you coming? Harry picks up a handful of papers from the Nix file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming. Billy is already out of the room.  For a moment. Harry pa to look back at the other files, sealed behind the spiked gates.  As he does so -- -- the proiector sparks into life one last time, and the "Psycho" appears --ROARING - at Harry's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shaddup! He FIRES at the projector a second time. On the GUN SHOT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and Harry are parting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, anytime. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, no.  This was enough.  They shake, and part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry waits on the doorstep.  Valentin opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want more money, is that it? Harry pushes him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry starts to go through the house, opening doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothea? He sees candle-light through a partially open door. Start towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! He pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a museum of Swarm's career.  Posters, and memorabilia everywhere.  And in the middle of the room, Swann's sealed CASKET, surrounded by flowers and candles. Dorothea is standing beside it, head bowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the way he wanted it... no autopsy, no embalming. Nobody meddling with his body... Harry approaches, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flesh is a trap.  That's what he used to say.  Flesh is a trap and magic sets us free. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't leave.  I was just digging around. Dorothea looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer Desiderio, for one. (he watches her for a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: response) She threw herself in front of a car this afternoon. Dorothea can't disguise her distress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothea pours herself a drink, while Harry spreads the PHOTOS and the PAPERS from the repository on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nix ran some kind of cult, right?  Some kind of Charlie Manson deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was more than that, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the real thing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swann said he could do stuff, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could get into people's heads.  Make them see things. Terrible things.  And he could levitate.  Juggle fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taught all this to Swann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some or it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin is listening at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Swann was performing magic. not illusions? (Dorothea nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?  You thought he should be using it to cure cancer, not making millions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much fame.  Yeah, I guess that'd turn anybody's head. Including yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you weren't with him for love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was grateful to him.  I owed him my life.  And he loved me. He couldn't always show it, but he felt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought Nix was coming back, didn't he? Dorothea is pouring herself another drink.  The glass sli from her hand.  It SHATTERS.  Harry goes to help her.  Th stoop together, very close.  The sexual attraction is alm palpable. Dorothea cuts herself on a shard of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! They are very close to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it isn't.  You can't help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, aren't I? He kisses her.  She kisses him back, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going to happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you don't want.  They kiss again, passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin breaks into the shadows, as Harry and Dorothea c the darkened lobby and head upstairs.  Then Valentin cros to the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room of illusions.  Walls lined with mirrors, and warm, flattering lighting, bathing the naked forms of Dorothea Harry as they make love, sitting on the floor. It is a deeply passionate, but slow, sensual coupling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin opens the front door.  There's a wind blowing. T palms churn against the night sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roiling, wind-filled pains with the glistening, urgent bo of Harry and Dorothea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry cradles Dorothea in post-coital languor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.  Nix can't hurt you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure. (kisses her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I'm the one who shot him. ON HARRY. He's startled, to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was twelve.  Nix took me hostage, to get Swann to come to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they all came...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaid and Jennifer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Pimm and Swann.  Only Nix was ready for them. There's a NOISE downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  Harry slips out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry descends the stairs, buttoning up his trousers (whi is all he wears).  He has his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin?  Dorothea appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?  Wait! Harry's at the bottom of the stairs now.  Across the hall a passageway, an eerie SILHOUETTE.  We can make out no de of clothing or face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell-? Suddenly, the shadowy FIGURE comes at Harry.  A BLAST of ENERGY bursts against Harry's face.  As it breaks against skin, we see (for three frames or so) a glimpse of Harry' skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah! Harry FIRES at the figure.  The shadows fold up around th Stranger like an origami puzzle.  He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him!  It's Nix! Harry goes out into the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin!  Get some lights on! As if in reply to the command, a burst of vivid white FIR erupts behind Harry.  He swings round to see the Stranger "unfolding" out of the shadows again, defying physics and physiology to do so.  The FIRE is at his feet, like a ser writhing on the ground.  It comes at Harry.  Harry FIRES it, but it comes at him faster still, rising to burn Harr leg.  He retreats, the FIRE racing after him. He makes fo door, and flings it open.  He's in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRE follows him across the ground and STRIKES his ha Harry drops the GUN.  Looks up to see the Stranger in the doorway, arm raised to will the fire-serpent on.  But the he hesitates.  Harry glances round, and sees that the Stranger - whose face is still a dark smear - is staring the CASKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody you know? Dorothea appears behind the Stranger.  Sees Harry, burned sweating, cornered against the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! The Stranger looks round.  Harry snatches up the GUN, supporting his burned hand with -his good hand.  Levels t gun at the Stranger.  The FIRE raises its head, like a co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which goes first?  My face or your heart? The Stranger draws a deep breath.  The Fire-Serpent withe and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who in God's name are you? She reaches for the Stranger, who simply folds up again; into darkness.  The WIND blows through the house, masking exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Valentin!  Find him!  Get him in here! Dorothea disappears.  Harry takes one of the candle-holde and jams it under the casket lid.  Wood splinters.  He st to force off the lid.  Valentin and Dorothea enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  This is sacrilege. He starts towards Harry.  Dorothea goes after him and cat hold of his arm.  Her expression is a mingling of fascina and dread, as Harry gets his fingers under the casket lid pulls.  Inside, Swann's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you satisfied now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Harry holds Valentin back with one hand, and puts his fin into the corpse's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.  It's not hurting... He now has four fingers in Swann's mouth and seizes hold his lower jaw.  It cracks --  -- and comes away in a little rain of plaster and latex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...plaster doesn't bleed. He tosses the jaw to Valentin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dorothea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like you're not a widow after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry interrogates Valentin in a white fury, while Doroth binds Harry's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rigged the illusion to fail, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paid off the doctor.  You set up the fake body.  Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.
